nav.div: Lebanon Schools » Departments » Health Services » COVID-19

img.alt: COVID-19 school closure updates and resources for families
img.longdesc: COVID-19 school closure updates and resources for families
img.title: COVID-19 school closure updates and resources for families

p.span: Following the Missouri Governor's announcement, Lebanon Schools will be closed the remainder of the school year. According to health officials, the practice of social distancing is critical to slowing the transmission of COVID-19.

li.span: On both Tuesdays and Fridays, multiple days of meals will be provided
On Fridays, weekend meals will also be included
Meals will be distributed at Maplecrest, LHS and designated bus stops
Free breakfast and lunch will continue to be available for all children 18 and under
Find your closest bus stop location and approximate time HERE

p.span: Our goal is to assist families in not needing to leave their homes as often, as well as reducing contact for both families and staff. When coming to any of our pickup locations (at the school buildings or bus stops), please maintain small groups and social distancing for everyone’s safety.

span.strong: PICKING UP PERSONAL BELONGINGS/DROPPING OFF SCHOOL MATERIALS

p.span: This letter shares information and a schedule for end-of-year pick-up of personal belongings as well as drop-off of library books, textbooks, and borrowed classroom materials.
We appreciate your continued flexibility and understanding week to week as we continue to figure out the best way to serve the needs of our school community during this evolving situation.
